text: The boilerplate buttons css class is .button but the default HubSpot button module uses .hs-button so if you add that module it doesn't pick up the theme styling. Could that default module be updated to either use or toggle the default class?
Hey Jacob :wave: thanks for flagging this! I just spun up a <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/issues/463|new issue> to track this with a bit more info on how we are looking to fix it.

:bee: Released a fresh <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/releases/tag/v3.9.0|minor update> to the boilerplate v3.9.0.
• Adds some additional form settings in theme settings to bring boilerplate up-to-date with new theme marketplace requirements
• Adds some additional hover state settings for generic buttons in theme settings.
Reminder: You can create a theme starting from the boilerplate a few different ways. Learn how <https://youtu.be/gBMaBD4G0fM>
